events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred last night, describing significant damage to the front bumper and engine compartment.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on descriptions mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
An agent has been assigned to handle the auto accident claim and to guide the customer through the next steps of the process.
The insurance company officially acknowledged the receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process has started.
The company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the accident damage, the police report, and an initial repair estimate.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacting the repair shop to verify damage and costs.
The investigation is complete; damages and liability have been confirmed consistent with the customer's report.
A settlement offer covering the vehicle repairs and associated costs has been proposed and communicated to the customer.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the speed and coverage provided.
The claim has been officially approved, authorizing the payment process to begin and vehicle repairs to proceed.
Payment for the approved claim amount has been issued to the customer's bank account to cover repair expenses.
The claim file has been closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs are underway.
The claim record has been archived for future reference and regulatory compliance after successful closure.
